You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
My Account Page

The My Account page provides self-service resources for a logged-in buyer to access their storefront account information and history. The My Account page consists of multiple sections, which you can configure independently. You can specify which information you allow a buyer to see and manage, including their password, saved addresses, order history, and more.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
USER EXPERIENCE COMPATIBILITY
Interface	Bootstrap 3 or classic
User visibility	Only logged-in users
IMPORTANT If the buyer's account isn't assigned to an account group, they can't access the My Account page.
TIP
In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) or later, you can show a dropdown menu for the My Account link in the header. The menu includes items that navigate to individual sections of the My Account page, which makes the sections accessible from anywhere on your storefront. This menu is also compatible with the B2B Commerce Header component in Experience Builder page.
In other versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce, the individual sections of the My Account page are accessible only from the My Account page itself.
NOTE Most sections of the My Account page aren’t compatible with logic and data service provider extensions and overrides for customizing the data shown on the storefront. Only the My Orders section of the My Account page is compatible with these extensions and overrides, and only when the API Fetch Orders configuration of the My Orders module is TRUE.
Show Account, Contact, and User Information on the My Account Page
To allow a buyer to easily view certain information from their account, contact, and user records directly on your storefront, show the Contact Information section.
Allow a Buyer to Change Their Storefront Password from the My Account Page
Provide controls for a buyer to manage their password for logging in to your storefront by showing the Change Password section of the My Account page.
Allow a Buyer to Manage Shipping and Billing Addresses on the My Account Page
Provide a buyer with self-service options for updating their shipping or billing addresses used in checkout.
Allow a Buyer to Manage Their Carts on the My Account Page
Provide a buyer with options for managing all the cart records they're entitled to access.
Specify Whether to Activate and Price a Cloned Cart
When a buyer clicks the Clone button on a cart from the My Carts section of the My Account page, you can specify what happens to the new cart.
Allow a Buyer to Manage Their Orders on the My Account Page
Provide a buyer with self-service options for searching orders, canceling orders, or reordering.
Allow a Buyer to Manage Stored Payments on the My Account Page
Provide a buyer with self-service options for creating and maintaining payment details used in checkout or to settle an invoice. When you enable the My Wallet section of the My Account page, a buyer can review, add, edit, or delete the account's stored payments.
Specify Default Pagination Options for All Sections of the My Account Page
When you show pagination controls in any section of the My Account page, you can specify which pagination options are available for a buyer to select.
Filter Information in the My Account Page by Effective Account
When you enable effective accounts, determine how you want to scope the information shown in the My Account page. You can filter all sections of the My Account page to show only the information that applies to a currently selected effective account. Alternatively, for some sections of the My Account page, you can show information from all effective accounts that the buyer can access.
SEE ALSO
Set Up the My Account Menu in the Header
Enable Buyer Entitlements with Account Groups

title: Customizing the My Account Page for B2B Commerce
